content: dear jeremy 2020 sucks bad in some big ways but i'm incredibly
grateful it's the year i found this wonderful hobby community your
content and the hobby have rejuvenated a spark in my creative passions and i'm
incredibly grateful i hope you find some extra joy and some
sparks in this big box of creative fun all the best jazza
you're right jazza 2020 has sucked and it's sucking in some pretty big ways
my goal with this week's video is to try and get through
some of that personal suckiness jazza sent me a prototype version of his
ultimate creativity collection which is essentially three
themed boxes full of all the stuff you need to get creative
in their different mediums i'm not going to delve too deep into showing you
what's all included in these boxes because despite what you're thinking
jazza and his sweet hobby box are not the sponsor of this video
but it was the catalyst and motivation for it it's been a rough week i'm
fortunate as where i live has been one of the safest places in
north america if not the world in regards to covid for the past several
months we had a summer that was essentially coveted free
with very few cases that have been well managed before turning into outbreaks
but if 2020 has taught us anything it's that things can change
very quickly and that's been the case here
we've gone from basically being covet free to having
the highest per capita caseload in all of canada
my immuno-compromised wife's workplace has a full-blown outbreak
and the night before filming this we got the first covet exposure letter from our
daughter's school and to top it off during filming the school
phone saying we had to pick up our daughter because she wasn't feeling well
all this is to say i was a little bit stressed out
during filming and my hope was that a bit of raw creativity would help take my
mind off things even if only for a few hours i figured
the best way to distract myself was with something completely different
so today i wanted to draw i grabbed this paper out of one of the boxes that
seemed really nice masked off a border and set myself up to do some art
now this box is an early version so it didn't come with the included
instructional booklets that you know tell you what the stuff is and
how to use it and well me selecting this paper without knowing what it was turned
out to be a bit of a mistake which you will get to in a bit i started off
with a rough pencil sketch of a skull because that seemed like a good place to
start by the end of it that skull became a plague bearer which was perfectly
alright with me building my 40k army has been a big part
of my private hobby life and i've really fallen in love with
these little demons and it's a subject matter that i thought
would be pretty forgiving for my limited artistic ability
in terms of perspective proportion scale and you know all the things that make a
drawing look good i used some markers that came in the box
to start lining the drawing it was at this point i realized the
paper was a little bit different something just wasn't right but i
pressed on and honestly had a lot of fun lining this guy out i was pretty pumped
with how this was looking there's nothing like some drips and lines and
scratchy ink to compensate for poor drawing skills
extra scribbles are kind of like the black wash of
drawing as soon as i started painting on some aqua inks
i knew there was a problem though and this paper was not
actually paper uh it turns out it's some type of thin plastic i think i'm still
not entirely sure what it's actually for it took the marker and pencil pretty
well but the second i started brushing on the inks
well the moisture just rehydrated the inks that hadn't actually stuck to the
paper plastic stuff and well it just started mixing into a big mess
and while i ponder how to fix this mess let's talk about this week's sponsor
skillshare skillshare is an online learning community with
thousands of inspiring classes for creative and curious people it's a great
place to explore new skills deepen existing passions and get lost in
creativity skillshare offers membership with
meaning with so much to explore real projects to create and the support
of fellow creatives skillshare gives you the tools to grow your passions
skillshare offers classes designed for real life and all of the circumstances
that come with it these lessons can help you stay inspired
express yourself and introduce you to a community of millions drawing
painting animation photography crafts skillshare is loaded with classes in
fields totally relevant to our miniature hobby
classes like mastering illustration sketching inking and color essentials
from my friend jazza who isn't this a tasty tie-in this is
the class that i need to spend some time with
i'm jumping into today's project totally blind with very little basic fundamental
knowledge of illustration taking some time to learn with jazza in
his class would have certainly given me a good head start while trying my hand
at illustration today classes are curated specifically for
learning meaning there's no ads and they're always launching new premium
classes so you can stay focused and follow wherever your creativity takes
you now is a better time than ever to unlock
some of your creativity and i'd like to help you do that
skillshare is very affordable at less than ten dollars a month with an annual
subscription but the first thousand people to use the
link in my description will get a free trial of skillshare premium membership
thanks skillshare for helping creative people develop their passions
and for sponsoring this video so uh drawing plan b i'm not beholden to
just using stuff from these boxes so i pilfered my daughter's crafting supplies
for a dollar store canvas this is what all the best
legitimate artists use right i did a quick test to see if markers would
actually stay put on the canvas after applying ink and
i decided to use some markers that i'm used to that i normally use and yeah
everything seemed pretty good so i set to work sketching out another
plague bearer face
now that i had a drawing inked up in a way that i wasn't concerned about
ruining i started to play with the aqua inks
again from the creativity box there was only yellow blue and red and i
wanted to see how much i could accomplish with just
those three colors thankfully the yellow and blue mixed together to create a
great plague bearer flesh color i really enjoyed this part of the
process as blending the colors right on the canvas was really satisfying and
really intuitive for me this is the part of the art process
where i feel somewhat competent in my ability and i get a lot more comfortable
exploring and mixing things i'm pretty sure that if i took some time
to develop basic illustration skills in order to get a handle on things like
perspective and proportion i could create some really good artwork
that i'd be super happy with since i feel like i
have a good eye for the inking and coloring portion all i really
need to do is find a way to get that good
basic drawing skill to build off of to make some legitimate artwork
but even with my line drawing being what it was i was still
really liking how it looked i thought since we're just exploring creativity
why not get weird and use some of the actual citadel washes
that i use on my nergo army as paint for this thing and you know
what it worked just fine
now i honestly wish i had left the drawing at this point but i decided it
needed a background so using those aqua inks again i mixed
up a very diluted purple ink and tried to create kind of like a splotchy and
interesting background purple seemed like a good choice for
contrast and i'm really just a big fan of
the purple and green combination
now while i think it looked better without the background i'm not too upset
about having it it still looks pretty cool and i don't
think it ruined it you know i'm not the best at drawing i
really am not but by allowing myself to do it
anyway despite that i managed to create a fun piece of art today and i'm pretty
proud of it i'm actually proud enough that i'm gonna
take some high-res photos and make it available for
purchase as prints and probably like some stickers you know
just in case somebody wants to hang this nasty boy in their house i'll put a link
in the description where you can grab one for yourself or maybe as a christmas
present for that special nuggle loving person in your life if you
enjoyed this vid hit the like button and let me know in the comments i want to
say a big thank you to my friend jazza for sending me one of his boxes to play
with doing something completely different today was
a much needed exercise to clear my stressed mind and
if you're having a rough day or week month
year i encourage you to maybe try something creative that is different
from what you normally do this distraction of playing in
unfamiliar mediums is really powerful and really useful for
clearing your head if you want to grab one of jazz's
creativity boxes i'll put a link in the video description where you can check it
out and if you want to pick up any other hobby supplies don't forget my essential
equipment page on blackmagiccraft.ca and last if you really enjoy these
videos that i make and you want to help me keep making them consider supporting
the channel on patreon i'd love to have you as the newest member of the black
magic craft fellowship that's it for this week guys
see you again next week cheers
